title: US strike kills four on suspected drug boat
description: A US strike has killed four people suspected of being drug smugglers in the eastern Pacific Ocean. #us #military #pacificocean #boat #petehegseth

title: Police officers wrestle loose emu in Arizona
description: Police officers in Arizona have been called in to help catch a runaway emu which had been seen sprinting through the streets of Cottonwood. #emu #police #runawayemu #arizona #cottonwood

title: AI tool helping to bust parcel scams this Christmas
description: Australia Post is fighting back against parcel scammers, using an AI counterfeit detection tool to weed out fake stamps and postage satchels. #post #auspost #ai #parcel #christmas

title: The simple rule to control your spending
description: It's the naughty habit hundreds of thousands of Aussies commit every week. Are you guilty of it? In this week's episode of Money Talks, powered by Vanguard, finance expert Melissa Browne reveals her hardline rule of 'if alcohol passes my lips, I cannot add to cart for 24 hours' is the quickest way she keeps her spending in control.   Money Talks is brought to you by Vanguard. #finance #money #investing #shares #vanguard All information in MoneyTalks is general in nature and does not take into account your personal circumstances. You should always seek independent, professional financial advice from a licensed expert before making any financial decisions. Past performance is not indicative of future results. For the full episode head to the 7NEWS YouTube channel.

title: Former NSW MP Gareth Ward sentenced to prison | 7NEWS
description: Former New South Wales MP Gareth Ward has been sentenced to five years and nine months in prison for the rape and indecent assault of two men in 2013 and 2015. The 44-year-old must serve at least three years and nine months before being eligible for parole, with the sentence delivered via video link from Hunter Valley jail where Ward has been held. Ward has filed an intention to appeal his convictions, which were handed down in July following a nine-week trial. title: Boy dies in e-bike collision on Sunshine Coast | 7NEWS
description: An eight-year-old boy died after his e-bike collided head-on with a 15-year-old rider on a bike path near Kawana Way and Sunshine Motorway interchange on the Sunshine Coast yesterday afternoon. The younger boy was taken to Sunshine Coast University Hospital in a life-threatening condition but later died from his injuries. The incident occurs as the Queensland state government conducts an enquiry into e-bike and e-scooter safety issues, with findings expected to be handed down in parliament next year. title: Greg Lynn appeals murder conviction and sentence | 7NEWS
description: Greg Lynn, a former pilot convicted of murdering Carol Clay in a 2020 campsite dispute, is appealing his conviction and 32-year jail sentence. The 59-year-old was found not guilty of Russell Hill's death and has maintained his innocence in both cases. Defence lawyers argue the sentence is manifestly excessive and the verdict was unsatisfactory. title: Melbourne cricket community mourns teenage player Ben Austin | 7NEWS
description: All local cricket games have been cancelled for a Melbourne league this weekend following the tragic death of 17-year-old Ben Austin. The cricket club has become a gathering place for the grieving community, with teammates and friends creating a growing memorial at the nets where Ben passed away. About 40 games have been cancelled as the cricket community rallies to support the Austin family. title: Trump announces nuclear testing resumption at APEC | 7NEWS
description: Donald Trump has announced the US will resume nuclear weapons testing for the first time since 1992, making the declaration via social media just before departing the APEC Summit in South Korea. The announcement has prompted discussions among world leaders, while South Korea has received new permission from Trump to build nuclear submarines using American technology, potentially affecting Australia's similar arrangements under ANZUS. title: Woman charged with baby murder in Baldivis | 7NEWS
description: A 28-year-old woman has been charged with the murder of an eight-month-old baby found dead at a Winpara Way property in Baldivis, Perth's south. The woman was discovered injured at the scene and taken to hospital, while neighbours reported hearing screaming and yelling before police arrived. Homicide detectives continue investigating the circumstances surrounding the tragic incident. title: Drunk driver arrested by residents after house crash | 7NEWS
description: An accused drunk driver crashed into a parked car in Melbourne, causing it to plough into a house. Residents performed a citizen's arrest after witnessing the driver attempt to flee while continuing to drink from a vodka can. The family inside the property escaped injury but face significant repair costs. title: Australia's top 250 young entrepreneurs revealed | 7NEWS
description: News Corp has revealed Australia's top 250 entrepreneurs under the age of 45, celebrating success stories that began in garages and bedrooms and evolved into companies spanning fashion, manufacturing, wellbeing, health and technology. The list highlights a broader trend where 86% of Generation Z want to be their own boss, shaping the next cohort of young business leaders. title: Police drain dam searching for missing boy Gus Lamont | 7NEWS
description: Police are draining a large dam located 600 metres from four-year-old Gus Lamont's family homestead in Yunta, more than one month after his disappearance on September 27. The dam, which is four and a half metres deep and contains roughly five million litres of water, was previously searched by police divers in the early days of the investigation. Authorities are now emptying the dam completely to examine the bottom and underwater vegetation to rule out the possibility that Gus may have drowned. title: Gareth Ward sentenced for rape and indecent assault
description: Former NSW MP Gareth Ward has been sentenced to five years and nine months behind bars for the rape of one man and indecent assault of another.  If you need help in a crisis, call Lifeline on 13 11 14. If you or someone you know is impacted by sexual assault, domestic or family violence, call 1800RESPECT on 1800 737 732 or visit 1800RESPECT.org.au  #garethward #crime #nswpol #nsw #court

title: THE DEBRIEF: King Charles strips Andrew's titles as Halloween spending hits record | 7NEWS
description: King Charles strips Prince Andrew of his royal titles and removes him from the Royal Lodge, with Andrew now to be known only as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor. Australians are set to spend a record $500 million on Halloween celebrations this year, marking an 11% increase in average spending per person. News Corp launches its Back Australia campaign asking readers to vote on what should be considered the national dish.
